concept.title: Relationship Tables (RelTables)
concept.shortdesc: Relationship tables in DITA maps define non-hierarchical links between topics, improving navigation in complex documentation.

conbody.p: Relationship tables are an advanced feature within DITA maps that allow you to explicitly define cross-references between topics that don't necessarily follow the hierarchical structure.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: In complex technical documentation, topics often need to reference related information that exists elsewhere in the hierarchy. Manually maintaining these cross-references becomes unmanageable as content grows. Relationship tables automatically generate appropriate links based on defined relationships.

section.title: Best Practice
section.p: Start with simple hierarchical organization, then add relationship tables as cross-referencing needs become clear. Over-engineering relationships early can create maintenance overhead.
